member.name: T:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection
member.summary: Represents a strongly-typed collection of key-and-value pairs that are sorted by the keys and are accessible by key and by index.

member.name: M:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that is empty, has the default initial capacity and is sorted according to the interface implemented by each key added to the MenuItemCollection.

member.name: M:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.GetKeyList
member.summary: Gets the keys in the MenuItemCollection.
member.returns: An containing the keys in the .

remarks.para: The returned is a read-only view of the keys in the . Modifications made to the underlying MenuItemCollection are immediately reflected in the IList.
The elements of the IList are sorted in the same order as the keys of the MenuItemCollection.
Similar to , but returns an IList instead of an .

Similar to , but returns an IList instead of an .

member.name: M:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.IndexOfKey(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the zero-based index of the specified key in the MenuItemCollection.
member.param: The key to locate in the .
member.returns: The zero-based index of , if is found in the ; otherwise, -1.

remarks.para: The elements of a are sorted by the keys either according to a specific implementation specified when the is created or according to the implementation provided by the keys themselves.

The index sequence is based on the sort sequence. When an element is added, it is inserted into in the correct sort order, and the indexing adjusts accordingly. When an element removed, the indexing also adjusts accordingly. Therefore, the index of a specific key-and-value pair might change as elements are added or removed from the .
This method uses a binary search algorithm; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to Log2(n), where n is .

member.name: M:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.IndexOfValue(Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItem)
member.summary: Returns the zero-based index of the first occurrence of the specified value in the MenuItemCollection.
member.param: The value to locate in the .
member.returns: The zero-based index of , if is found in the ; otherwise, -1.

remarks.para: The index sequence is based on the sort sequence. When an element is added, it is inserted into in the correct sort order, and the indexing adjusts accordingly. When an element removed, the indexing also adjusts accordingly. Therefore, the index of a specific key-and-value pair might change as elements are added or removed from the .
The values of the elements of the are compared to the specified value using the Equals method.
This method uses a linear search; therefore, the average execution time is proportional to .

exception.para: The MenuItemCollection has a fixed size.

member.name: M:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.Remove(System.String)
member.summary: Removes the element with the specified key from the MenuItemCollection.
member.param: The key of the element to remove.

exception.para: The MenuItemCollection has a fixed size.

member.remarks: If the does not contain an element with the specified key, the MenuItemCollection remains unchanged. No exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.RemoveAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes the element at the specified index of the MenuItemCollection.
member.param: The zero-based index of the element to remove.
member.exception: is outside the range of valid indices for the .

exception.para: The MenuItemCollection has a fixed size.

remarks.para: The index sequence is based on the sort sequence. When an element is added, it is inserted into in the correct sort order, and the indexing adjusts accordingly. When an element removed, the indexing also adjusts accordingly. Therefore, the index of a specific key-and-value pair might change as elements are added or removed from the .

In collections of contiguous elements, such as lists, the elements that follow the removed element move up to occupy the vacated spot. If the collection is indexed, the indices of the elements that are moved are also updated.

The to save into the .
member.exception: is outside the range of valid indices for the .

remarks.para: The index sequence is based on the sort sequence. When an element is added, it is inserted into in the correct sort order, and the indexing adjusts accordingly. When an element removed, the indexing also adjusts accordingly. Therefore, the index of a specific key-and-value pair might change as elements are added or removed from the .

member.name: P:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.System#Collections#IDictionary#Item(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets and sets the value associated with a specific key in the MenuItemCollection.
member.value: The associated with in the , if is found; otherwise, a is thrown.
member.remarks: This property, unlike its equivalent in , does not return null when a key cannot be found. The reason for this is that the strongly-typed sorted list template this class is created from allows the value to be a value type (or struct), which cannot be set to null. Instead, a is thrown when a key cannot be found. Callers must either catch this exception, or call the method first to see if the key exists.
member.exception: Either the or the are not of a type supported by the .

member.name: P:Ecyware.GreenBlue.GreenBlueGUI.MenuItemCollection.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets and sets the value associated with a specific key in the MenuItemCollection.
member.value: The associated with in the , if is found; otherwise, a is thrown.

remarks.para: This property, unlike its equivalent in , does not return null when a key cannot be found. The reason for this is that the strongly-typed sorted list template this class is created from allows the value to be a value type (or struct), which cannot be set to null. Instead, a is thrown when a key cannot be found. Callers must either catch this exception, or call the method first to see if the key exists.
